intro: Sonchus balthicus, commonly known as the Balthic sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with heart-shaped, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in agricultural fields. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it an invasive species in some regions.
